FindingName: MFA Not Required for Device Registration
Description: No Conditional Access Policies were found that enforce the use of multi-factor authentication when registering a device with the tenant. Configuring and requiring multi-factor authentication for device registration can aid in preventing compromised user credentials from being used to associate unauthorized devices with the organization.
Remediation: Create Conditional Access Policies that enforces multi-factor authentication when registering a device with Entra ID. Navigate to Entra ID/Microsoft Entra → Navigate to Conditional Access (Security → Conditional Access in Entra ID/Protect & Secure → Conditional Access in Microsoft Entra) → Select '+ New Policy' → Select Users → 'All Users' → Select 'Cloud apps or actions' → change the dropdown to 'User Actions' → Select 'Register or join devices' → Select 'Grant Controls' → Select 'Require multifactor authentication' (alternatively, select 'Require authentication strength' and configure the required strength levels) → Change the 'Enable policy' value to 'On' → Select 'Create'.
